title: 108_hr1112
content: The Act may be cited as the "Bankruptcy Judgeship Act of 2003" and establishes permanent judgeships. Section 152(a)(2) of title 28, United States Code, is amended to adjust the number of districts in various states. The number of districts in various states is adjusted as follows: in Michigan, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Pennsylvania, Puerto Rico, and South Carolina, the numbers are updated by striking and inserting new values. In Tennessee, Utah, and Virginia, district numbers are adjusted by changing values. SEC. 3. TEMPORARY JUDGESHIPS. Temporary Judgeships: Additional bankruptcy judges will be appointed in various districts including Georgia, Maryland, and Mississippi. One additional bankruptcy judge will be appointed in the district of Pennsylvania and one in the district of Puerto Rico. Vacancies occurring 5 years after the appointment date of a bankruptcy judge shall not be filled. Temporary office extensions are authorized for the northern district of Alabama and the eastern district of Tennessee. The temporary office extensions for bankruptcy judges in the district of Tennessee are extended until the first vacancy occurs, 5 years after the enactment of this Act. All other provisions of the Bankruptcy Judgeship Act of 1992 remain applicable. Technical amendments are made to Section 152(a) of title 28, United States Code. The appointment process for bankruptcy judges in judicial districts is specified, with amendments to the number of judges in certain districts. The effective date for these amendments is the date of the enactment of the Act.
